text:
or 1/5 palpable above the brim (0/5 only at a CHC).
• Certainty about the position of the presenting part.
• Cervix fully dilated.
• Membranes ruptured.
• Bladder empty.
• Strong (regular) uterine contractions
Technique 
• Ventouse delivery techniques vary with different equipment and operators:
o check the equipment thoroughly before use by testing suction on the gloved hand
o aim for a negative pressure of at least -0.6 Bar to -0.8 Bar in the cup (do not exceed a pressure of 0.8
